title: Interpreting the Meaning of g(f(x))
text: If $$f(g(x))=x$$, then $$g(x)=f^{\left(-1\right)} x$$ and $$f(x)=g^{\left(-1\right)} x$$. If f(g(x)) is not equal to $$x$$, then these statements are false.
